description.value: Yagudo feathers, even their flight feathers, can vary in length depending on genetics. Long-Cloaked Yagudo have naturally much longer plume feathers that hang down to their ankles while standing. Due to the weight and size of their feathers, extended flight is tougher and more unwieldy for these yagudo. Instead, most long-cloaked yagudo have spent time refining their control over their feathers, using them as weapons as well as producing blustering twisters that can serve to give them or others a lift.
